snippet: During Charlie Beljan’s final chance to avoid having to requalify for the PGA Tour, his throat tightened and his heart raced. What happened next was one of the most frightening — and remarkable — rounds of golf ever.
abstract: Golfer Charlie Beljan, whose panic attack caused him to be hospitalized after second round of PGA Tour tournament, returns following day to finish final rounds and capture his first Tour victory; claims that multiple life-altering events unrelated to golf, like his recent marriage and birth of his first child, contributed to his stress.

byline.original: By KAREN CROUSE and BILL PENNINGTON

lead_paragraph: During Charlie Beljan’s final chance to avoid having to requalify for the PGA Tour, his throat tightened and his heart raced. What happened next was one of the most frightening — and remarkable — rounds of golf ever.

headline.seo: Charlie Beljan’s Panic Leads to Hospital and Then PGA Title
headline.main: Panic Attack Leads to Hospital on Way to Golfer’s First Victory
headline.print_headline: Panic Attack Leads to Hospital On Way to Golfer’s First Victory
